intro: Phymatopsis rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
